subject: Leadership
title: The Ethics of Compromise
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Ethics of Compromise.

hook.text: Leaders compromise daily. Some compromises are wise. Others erode integrity so slowly you don't notice until it's gone.

buildup.text: Margolis: ethical compromise exists on a spectrum from principled concession to total capitulation. Location matters.

discovery.text: Principled compromise means giving ground on tactics while holding firm on values. The 'what' flexes, the 'why' doesn't.

twist.text: Slippery slopes are real. Each small concession makes the next one easier until you can't find the line you crossed.

climax.text: Define your non-negotiables in advance. Write them down. When the pressure comes, you'll have an anchor to hold onto.

punchline.text: Know the line you won't cross before someone asks you to cross it.

quiz.question: What is principled compromise?
options: Giving in on everything to avoid conflict
Flexing on tactics while holding firm on core values
